casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. UNITED STATES FIDELITY AND GUARANTY COMPANY, Defendant-Appellee. No. 71-2245. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. June 1, 1973. Richard A. Scully, Washington, D. C. (argued), Dean C. Smith, U. S. Atty., Carroll D. Gray, Asst. U. S. Atty., Spokane, Wash., Scott P. Crampton, Asst. Atty. Gen., Meyer Rothwacks, Crombie J. D. Garrett, John J. McCarthy, John M. Dowd, Tax Div., Dept. of Justice, Washington, D. C., for plaintiff-appellant. Richard C. Fields (argued), of Moffatt, Thomas, Barrett & Blanton, Boise, Idaho, Eugene I. Annis, of Myers, Reiley & Annis, Spokane, Wash., for defendantappellee.

Before KILKENNY and GOODWIN, Circuit Judges, and BELLONI,* District Judge.

Honorable Robert C. BeUoni, United States District Judge, District of Oregon, sitting by designation.

 PER CURIAM:

The judgment of the district court, denying plaintiff’s motion for summary judgment and granting defendant’s motion for summary judgment is affirmed for the reasons given therein, as reported in 328 F.Supp. 69 (E.D.Wash.1971).

Affirmed.
